channel.title: Auhome | Mail Online
channel.description: Daily Mail Australia - all the latest Australian news, sport, showbiz, science and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers

item.title: Colorado theater gunman James Holmes AVOIDS death sentence and jailed for life
item.description: Jurors in Arapahoe County, Colorado, failed to reach a unanimous verdict on whether Holmes deserved capital punishment or not - meaning that he will spend life in prison instead.
item.media:description: James Holmes sits in court for an advisement hearing at the Arapahoe County Justice Center in Centennial, Colorado, in this file photo taken June 4, 2013. Jurors in the Colorado cinema massacre trial were deliberating on Friday whether gunman Holmes should be put to death for killing 12 people and wounding 70 three years ago inside a packed midnight screening of a Batman film. REUTERS/Andy Cross/Pool/Files

item.title: Worker hit by falling scaffolding on a Barangaroo construction site
item.description: A man has been seriously injured at a work site in Barangaroo after he was hit by metal scaffolding that fell from a fork lift.

item.title: Bobbi Kristina Brown’s boyfriend Nick Gordon 'fed her drugs in the bath'
item.description: The suit, filed on Friday, is the latest step prosecutors have made since filing a 'wrongful death' case against Gordon in June, accusing him of assault, battery, and stealing Brown's money.

item.title: Lara Bingle looks loved up as she and Sam Worthington coo over baby boy Rocket on sweet family day out
item.description: The loved-up couple, who have been together since late 2013, looked head over heels while strolling through sunny Central Park with five-month-old son Rocket Zot on Friday.
item.media:description: NEW YORK, NY - AUGUST 07: Sam Worthington and Lara Bingle seen taking their baby boy Rocket for a walk on August 7, 2015 in New York City. (Photo by Charles Bladen/GC Images)

item.title: Married sex worker, 22, reveals what it's like to earn a living in the seedy industry
item.description: A woman has welcomed questions from complete strangers on what it’s really like to be an Australian sex worker. The 22 year-old posted an ‘Ask Me Anything’ on Reddit.

item.title: From empty private jets to a family break in Sydney over Christmas: The latest taxpayer funded expenses scandals rocking Tony Burke and Christopher Pyne
item.description: Labor frontbencher Tony Burke used an Australian government jet to ferry him to meetings in 2010, spending $16,000 over the three days. This included empty flights, when no one was on board.

item.title: Sydney girl who hanged herself at Kidz Klub Playland and Cafe was found by children
item.description: A police investigation is underway after a young girl was rushed to hospital after she was found with her scarf wrapped around her neck and hanging from monkey bars in a play centre in Sydney's west.

item.title: How washing your hands does ward off colds
item.description: The spread of colds and other viruses could be slowed and winter pressures on the NHS reduced if people are encouraged to wash their hands more frequently, researchers say.

item.title: Why we've forgotten how to knit but can use Wi-Fi
item.description: A study has revealed the top 20 traditional skills that are dying out in a world of convenience and technology - and they include knitting, reading a map and being able to change a tyre (pictured).

item.title: Science Advances reveals our eye shape helped turn humans into hunters
item.description: A study found humans became successful hunters (file photo) because our eyes have circular pupils, as opposed to the elongated horizontal ones of plant-eating animals such as sheep.

item.title: After Fergus Hillman, there's now more bouffant babies!
item.description: Since MailOnline printed the picture of six-month-old Fergus Hillman, whose full head of hair needs near-constant trimming, hundreds of parents have sent in photos of their carefully coiffed cuties.

item.title: Lesley Anderson Edwards thinks she has spotted her son Jon at Chelsea match
item.description: Lesley Edwards has been searching for her son, Jon Anderson Edwards, since last September, when he was reported missing after he failed to turn up for his job as a chef in Lagos, Portugal.

item.title: Django Unchained actress Daniele Watts ordered to rewrite apology letter to LAPD
item.description: Daniele Watts' first note merely apologized to the police officer for disturbing 'your carefree coffee break' and thanked him for giving her the opportunity to shine a light on racial profiling.

item.title: Ohio man accused of setting fiancée on fire says it was an 'accident'
item.description: Michael Slager, 40, allegedly set Judith Malinowski, 31, ablaze behind a Speedway gas station in Gahanna, Ohio, on Sunday, at 5.pm. The incident left Malinowski hospitalized.

item.title: Candy Man, Travers Beynon, welcomes three new Goddesses into his mansion
item.description: The controversial Candy Man is in the midst of a huge life upgrade - juggling the arrival of three new glamorous live-in 'Goddesses' with a major renovation at his luxurious Gold Coast mansion.

item.title: Speech clinics help transgender patients find their voices
item.description: The University of Connecticut's Speech and Hearing Clinic is one of a growing number of clinics with programs.

item.title: Heddwen Jones heartbroken as marriage to Turkish waiter breaks down
item.description: Heddwen Jones, 39, from Denbigh, north Wales, says her ex-husband Bekir Gunes, 34, who now owns a kebab shop, put her down for piling on the pounds after having their children aged 11 and five.

item.title: Slicing a bagel along the 'Mobius Strip' is best way to add more filling
item.description: A video shows how to cut a bagel into a Möbius strip, which a famous mathematical structure that only has one side, providing more surface area to spread cream cheese.

item.title: MH370 mystery could be solved from the crustaceans on plane debris
item.description: Brian Helmuth, a professor at Northeastern's Marine Science Center, says that the barnacles could clue investigators in to the debris' likely path as well as to how deep it had sunk in the ocean.

item.title: Telling a person they're fat makes them even fatter
item.description: Psychologists found that believing you are overweight is counter productive – highlighting a problem for doctors trying to combat the obesity epidemic.

item.title: Man spends 20 years saving up to buy ring for childhood sweetheart
item.description: On Saturday, Liang Liang used 12,000 yuan in coins to buy a proposal ring in Fuyang city, northwestern Anhui province, fulfilling his promise to one day marry his childhood sweetheart.

item.title: Dogs that sniff out prostate cancer can detect tumours with 93% accuracy
item.description: Dogs have been specially trained to detect prostate, bladder and kidney tumours to an accuracy rate of 93 per cent – far higher than current testing methods.

item.title: Princess Beatrice joins Oprah Winfrey on mega-yacht off Ibiza coast
item.description: The 26-year-old was seen with her boyfriend Dave Clark on the Chelsea owner's luxury boat - once the world's largest superyacht - which was docked off the Spanish coast.

item.title: Mars salt flats could be last place water survived on the red planet
item.description: Researchers have discovered evidence of an ancient lake that likely represents some of the last potentially habitable surface water ever to exist on the Red Planet.
item.media:description:
Salt flat indicates some of the last vestiges of surface water on Mars, CU-Boulder study finds -
Mars turned cold and dry long ago, but researchers at the University of Colorado Boulder have discovered evidence of an ancient lake that likely represents some of the last potentially habitable surface water ever to exist on the Red Planet.
The study, published Thursday in the journal Geology, examined an 18-square-mile chloride salt deposit (roughly the size of the city of Boulder) in the planet?s Meridiani region near the Mars Opportunity rover?s landing site. As seen on Earth in locations such as Utah?s Bonneville Salt Flats, large-scale salt deposits are considered to be evidence of evaporated bodies of water.
Digital terrain mapping and mineralogical analysis of the features surrounding the deposit indicate that this one-time lakebed is no older than 3.6 billion years old, well after the time period when Mars is thought to have been warm enough to sustain large amounts of surface

item.title: Android flaw 'Certifi-gate' lets hackers listen in on conversations and steal data
item.description: The flaw could allow hackers to 'steal personal data, track device locations, turn on microphones to record conversations', the firm that discovered it says.
item.media:description:
A hacker with a laptop.
D99KXY

item.title: Apple spends $700k-a-year on security for CEO Tim Cook
item.description: Apple said the huge sum was for 'home and personal security' for Cook, but the huge sum is still less than half of the $1.6million that Amazon reportedly spends per year protecting Jeff Bezos.
item.media:description:
Timothy Cook, CEO of Apple, delivers opening remarks while testifying before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee's Investigations Subcommittee about the company's offshore profit shifting and tax avoidance in the Dirksen Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC.
A Congressional report released yesterday said that Apple, America's most profitable technology company, used a complex system of international subsidiaries and tax avoidance efforts to shift at least $74 billion out of the reach of the Internal Revenue Service between 2009 and 2012. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images) *** BESTPIX *** WASHINGTON, DC - MAY 21:

item.title: Couple's 1st dance begins to Justin Timberlake before busting out 6-minute routine
item.description: Hollie and Dave Smith shunned the traditional slow, romantic first dance in favour of an all-singing, all-dancing routine, which the British couple choreographed for their special day.

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West's new baby boy's name will be Easton
item.description: Kim has said that the name for Baby No. 2 will be 'directionless.' But a family friend has spilled the beans to Daily Mail Online about the moniker of the baby boy due at the end of the year.

item.title: Paraplegic Emma Carey overcame disability and is now a fitness role model
item.description: Diagnosed as a paraplegic by her doctors in Switzerland after a freak skydiving accident, Australian Emma Carey amazed everyone when she got back on her feet just one year later.

item.title: weatherView shows Typhoon Soudelor hitting land via an interactive map
item.description: Named weatherView, the map allows you to switch on various layers showing the planet’s temperature, precipitation, moisture and pressure, as well as see the world's air currents in detail.

item.title: Photographer Ivette Ivens documents her baby and French bulldog
item.description: Photographer Ivette Ivens, originally from Lithuania but now living in Chicago, has documented the 'out-of-control cuteness' of her son Dilan and their pet puppy Farley, who were born on the same day.

item.title: Migrants scattered across Mediterranean Sea after fishing boat capsized
item.description: These were the heart-rendering scenes 15 miles off the coast of Libya on Wednesday where a rescue mission went disastrously and tragically wrong, leading to the deaths of 200 migrants.

item.title: Two Georgia women arrested 'for keeping special needs siblings in cages
item.description: Stephanie Stone (pictured), 34, and Wanda Redfern, 49, of Georgia, have been charged with cruelty to children and false imprisonment after officers found Stone's 11-year-old son caged.

item.title: Florida brothers Elias and D.C. Goutoufas hear each other for the first time
item.description: Elias and D.C. Goutoufas, who are from Tampa, Florida, have been deaf all their lives due to a congenital defect. The moment they heard each other for the first time was captured on video.

item.title: England close to an historic Ashes 2015 win over Australia, leaving their arch-rivals with an almost impossible task at Trent Bridge as Ben Stokes stars by taking five wickets during the second day
item.description: PAUL NEWMAN AT TRENT BRIDGE: Ben Stokes has shown what a brilliant batsman he can be this season and now, thrillingly, he demonstrated that his bowling is top class.

item.title: UFC fighter Ronda Rousey shows off bikini body in Rio de Janeiro
item.description: The 28-year-old has been touring Rio de Janeiro with her family throughout this week after successfully defending her title against Bethe Correia in Brazil on Saturday night.

item.title: What happens to your body after eating bacon revealed in parody infographic
item.description: The Coke picture, which explains what happens to your body withing the first hour of drinking, recently went viral. Since then, people have been inspired to make similar graphics - with a comedic twist.

item.title: Is this the most horrifying prank ever? Man is tricked into thinking his ‘blood-soaked’ friend has been killed by an axe murderer video
item.description: Norwegian prankster Tom should have expected retribution after waking his friend up with a roaring chainsaw - without a blade - (pictured) but friends Marius went above and beyond with this ruse.

item.title: Couple of 68 years reunited while both are patients in Piedmont Fayette Hospital
item.description: A hospital worker's actions brought a 96-year-old man to tears after she helped to reunite him with his beloved wife of 68 years. The couple was put in separate rooms at Piedmont Fayette Hospital.

item.title: Jenson Button and his wife being gassed by thieves doubted by French police
item.description: French police and medical experts have cast serious doubts over claims that Formula One driver Jenson Button and his wife Jessica were 'gassed' in their French villa as they slept while on holiday.

item.title: The honeymoon crashers! Maid of honor Courteney Cox and more Hollywood pals join Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux on love boat in Bora Bora
item.description: The couple are seen here aboard their loveboat - along with a gaggle of their Hollywood pals, including Jen's former Friends co-star Courteney Cox, 51, who also served as her maid of honor.
item.media:description:
Picture Shows: Amanda Anka, Jason Bateman, Coco Arquette, Courteney Cox, Justin Theroux, Jennifer Aniston, Johnny McDaid August 07, 2015
 
 **MINIMUM WEB USAGE £500**
 
 Actress Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux start their honeymoon and brought along some of their closest friends for the trip in Bora Bora. 
 
 The couple wed in a ceremony at their Bel Air home on Wednesday night in front of 75 of their friends and family and apparently decided to keep the party rolling and brought some of them along for their honeymoon! 
 
 **MINIMUM WEB USAGE £500**
 
 Exclusive All round

item.title: Beverly Hills mansion with bullet-proof safe room on sale for $29million
item.description: This European-style mansion in Beverly Hills, California, could be yours - if you are willing to fork out a whopping $29million. It is being sold by the estate of the late cardiologist Leonardo Berezovsky.

item.title: Cocoa motors reveal WalkCar, small enough to fit in a backpack
item.description: The $800 'WalkCar' is small enough to fit in a backpack, and has a top speed of 6.2 miles per hour. To steer, the user just shifts their weight.

item.title: Teen couple Dylan and Lexie survive lightning strike by holding hands
item.description: A doctor told Dylan and Lexie of Claremont, California that holding hands helped diffuse the electrical current that hit them.

item.title: SkyWest plane bursts into FLAMES at Nashville International Airport
item.description: The Delta-operated regional jet, carrying dozens of passengers, caught fire after the pilot turned on its engine while departing Nashville International Airport in Tennessee on Friday.

item.title: Boars WASH their food before eating it at Basel Zoo, Switzerland
item.description: When presented with grubby apples, a group of boars at Basel Zoo, Switzerland carry the treats to a river using their snouts and carefully wash them in the water.

item.title: Gable Tostee posts rant on Facebook pleading his innocence
item.description: Accused 'balcony killer' Gable Tostee has incited social media storm following Facebook posts claiming that he attempted to kick Warriena Wright out of Gold Coast flat before she plunged to her death.

item.title: Mackeral attacks surfer who suffers broken cheek and dislocated jaw
item.description: A 27-year-old surfer fell from his board off the coast of Sao Vicente, Brazil, and suffered severe facial injuries. Surgeons removed the jaw of a white snake mackerel (pictured) from his nasal cavity.

item.title: Predators have vertical slits for pupils, while prey have 'letterbox' shaped holes
item.description: Scientists at the University of California at Berkeley studied the eyes of 214 land species to deduce that predators have differently shaped eyes to prey.

item.title: Super typhoon Soudelor to hit Taiwan and China with wind speeds of 100mph
item.description: Full force of Typhoon Soudelor is expected to hit Taiwan August 7 and 8. South eastern coast of China will also be affected by the tropical storm. 2,000 people have been evacuated and two died.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Yes, Donald Trump can be vicious, arrogant, obnoxious and even a little bit evil – which is exactly why a lot of people think he will make a bloody good President
item.description: Whether you love him or hate him, isn’t it fantastically refreshing to see someone stomping around the political arena who DOESN’T behave like a robotic, media-trained, timid little mouse?

item.title: NSW prison smoking ban on Monday means nicotine patches and special riot teams
item.description: Intimidating specialist riot squads are prepared for the worst as a smoking ban is introduced on Monday across all NSW prisons, following a violent rampage in a Melbourne prison for the same ban.

item.title: Princess Mary leaves the family at home and shows off her royal style at Copenhagen fashion week in a glamorous floor length black gown
item.description: Princess Mary has proved she is the epitome of class and style after stepping out at Copenhagen fashion week with friend and actress Ellen Hillingsoe, donning an elegant black gown for the occasion.

item.title: Steve Jobs refused to pay Chrisann Brennan $25million she claims in letters
item.description: The late Apple founder rebuffed the mother of his eldest daughter, Chrisann Brennan, when she asked him to set up a trust fund for her as compensation for raising Lisa.

item.title: Obese student addicted to junk food dropped 5 dress sizes over summer holidays
item.description: Adele Morgan, 20 from Ottershaw, Surrey weighed 12st when she was shocked into losing weight after seeing a photograph of her during a trip to South Africa. She is now a size eight.

item.title: Pprune reveals what cabin crew REALLY think of celebrities they've served
item.description: Most of the comments on Pprune.org are very positive – but some famous types have proved extremely unpopular, though it’s often not made clear exactly why.

item.title: Bigfoot sighting in North Carolina in Henderson County by Eric Walters and dog Zippy
item.description: A man from Boone vacationing near Asheville claims to have captured video of Sasquatch crossing the road in Henderson County. Eric Walters was walking his dog Zippy when he saw it.

item.title: Inside Sonagachi, Asia's largest red light district with hundreds of brothels
item.description: The seedy world of Sonagachi, in the western city of Kolkata, is swamped with hundreds of multi-storey brothels, housing roughly 14,000 prostitutes who travel work here from all over India.

item.title: Gary and Phil Neville’s father Neville has died after heart attack on flight to Australia
item.description: Neville Neville flew to Sydney to watch his daughter Tracey, who is manager of the England netball team at the World Cup, but he suffered a suspected heart attack en route.

item.title: Violent domestic disputes are exposing Australian children to 'horrendous' scenes
item.description: Family violence exposes children to appalling incidents with one mother's kids having to help to hold her organs in her body, an inquiry was told.

item.title: Duston woman left mortified by unflattering wedding snaps loses SEVEN STONE
item.description: Sarah Oldham, 32, from Duston, Northampton, weighed 16st and wore a size 22 bridesmaid dress for her sister's wedding. After seeing the photos she took up bodybuilding to shrink to 8st 7lb.

item.title: Shocking footage shows a giant whale shark being sawed into pieces and sold at a Chinese market while STILL ALIVE
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: The sickening clip shows the whale shark opening and closing its mouth as it's butchered in front a crowd, including young children, at a marketplace in China.

item.title: Queensland boy born with severe facial deformity has battled to survive
item.description: Little 19-month-old Robbie Milne from Queensland has undergone more than the average person will in their entire lifetime after being born with cleft palate and an extremely rare genetic disorder.

item.title: Kenyan teen reveals how she was forced to undergo female genital mutilation
item.description: Damaris Monty, 14, from Tangulbei, Kenya, was forced to undergo the procedure without anesthetic when she was just 11. A year later, she fell pregnant with Chepkopus Domoren, two.

item.title: Could the position you SLEEP in affect your risk of Alzheimer's?
item.description: Those who sleep on their side, as opposed to on their back or front, appear able to clear our more of the day's chemical clutter from their brain while they rest, say Stony Brook University researchers.

item.title: Jukuja Dolly Snell wins $50,000 award for her spectacular painting
item.description: Artist Jukuja Dolly Snell won a $50,000 prize for the overall 2015 National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Award, while several other artists won awards in their fields.

item.title: Urban Stash Spot Clothing tells New Jersey mom whose son died of overdose: ‘I’d kill him myself'
item.description: New Jersey mom Patty DiRenzo (pictured with her son) confronted Urban Stash Spot Clothing over its drug-inspired designs. Three workers emailed her back, calling her a 'b***h' and 'lowlife'.

item.title: United Airlines passenger punched by 'drunk man who refused to turn off phone'
item.description: Footage shows the unruly passenger at Chicago's O'Hare Airport removing his hand luggage from the overhead bin before he pauses, speaks to a man in the front row and then throws a punch.

item.title: Port Douglas mansion is being TORN APART after owner replicated a home down the street
item.description: The Supreme Court in Cairns ruled a house built in Port Douglas (pictured) - north of Cairns in Queensland - was a replica of a home down the street worth $1.15 million.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo strips off to reveal his body in UNRETOUCHED photos
item.description: The Portuguese footballer, who plays for Real Madrid, can be seen modelling his favourite new CR7 Underwear styles as he demonstrates some of his signature moves.

item.title: Botswana elephants enjoy drinking from a toilet rather than their water hole
item.description: Sneaking out for a quick call of nature, one camper got the surprise of her life when she came across an elephant drinking out of one of the campsite lavatories in Botswana.

item.title: Australian buyers borrowing on average $340,200 to secure a house
item.description: New home loan data has revealed that rising property prices across Australia forced first home buyers to take out an average loan of $340,200 to secure a house in June.

item.title: Uber forced to hike its prices by 10% after new ruling by tax office
item.description: Drivers of the popular 'Uber' app are forced to charge 10% more for their fares, after a ruling by the Australian Taxation Office places the ride-sharing service in the same category as taxi operators.

item.title: At least four dead as Mali gunmen 'try to kidnap' Western hotel guests
item.description: The Malian army has surrounded the hotel in Sevare in the Mopti region of Mali, about 370 miles north of the capital Bamako.
item.media:description: epa03555433 Malian forces patrol through the northern town of Sevare, Mali 25 January 2013. French forces continue their advance northwards in Mali with over 2,000 troops assisting Malian forces fight islamic militants linked to al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb. EPA/STR

item.title: Saudi Arabia women surrounded by jeering men as they walk along promenade
item.description: In the minute-long video, the two young women - dressed in traditional burkhas and face veils - become visibly distressed as they are harassed and intimidated by the men.

item.title: AJ Kearns born a woman paused transition so he could give birth featured on ABC
item.description: Melbourne man AJ Kearns describes himself as an ordinary father of two. But unlike most fathers, he was the one who gave birth to his three-year-old daughter Luka.

item.title: Sydney thrilled to get a pop-up Kit Kat studio in Westfield
item.description: Create-your-own Kit Kat Bar in Sydney, after a pop-up Kit Kat studio has opened up in Westfield, located in the heart of the city. Consumers can use up to 3 ingredients per creation.

item.title: Melbourne crane collapses with driver on board when hydraulic ram fails
item.description: A huge crane has collapsed on itself just before 4pm in Southbank, inner Melbourne. Only one worker was seriously injured, but chaotic peak hour traffic is expected with several lanes closed.

item.title: Donald Trump's family photographed in Republican debate audience
item.description: His wife Melania watched from the audience, and joined him on stage after his performance. She was joined by Trump siblings Ivanka, Eric and Tiffany at the Quicken Loans arena in Cleveland, Ohio.

item.title: Roman Abramovich agrees to lend £1.5bn superyacht to rapper Timati
item.description: Russian rapper Timati has thanked Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich for the loan of his £1.5 billion super yacht Eclipse - and promised not to break the dishes or bring girls on board.

item.title: Sydney's Lorn Cheng jailed over failed drug smuggling attempt
item.description: 50-year-old Sydney Grandmother, Lorn Cheng, has been sentenced to eight years jails for swallowing 252 pellets of heroin weighing 643.6 grams (pictured) to pay of a $10,000 gambling debt.

item.title: Chongqing guest house listed for demolition remains open
item.description: Hotel is situated in the South Bank district of Chongqing, south west China. Negotiation for the demolition compensation haven't been finalised yet to owners have decided to keep hotel open.

item.title: Faith Clifford stood by husband wrongly accused of downloading child porn for 9 YEARS
item.description: Faith Clifford, 54, from Hertfordshire, had her life turned upside down when Jeremy was charged with possessing indecent images. After helping him clear his name she has now released a book.

item.title: The foods that will give you a radiant glow in under a WEEK
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Nutritionist Fiona Kirk has devised a Super Skin Diet which she recommends following for 3 to 7 days before and/or after your long-awaited summer break for a glowing complexion.

item.title: Sydney's Taronga Zoo's brush-tailed rock wallabies emerge from mothers' pouches
item.description: Two tiny Brush-tailed Rock Wallaby joey's have emerged from their mother's pouches at Sydney's Taronga Zoo, in Australia.

item.title: Siege in Caboolture ends as man hands himself in after 'bomb threats'
item.description: A dramatic six-hour siege in the northern Brisbane suburb of Caboolture has ended, after a man who locked himself in an apartment block and made bomb threats to police surrendered at 5.35pm.
item.media:description:
An emergent situation has been declared at Lee Street Caboolture this afternoon.
Around 10.40am police attended a unit in Lee Street to speak to a man. The man has locked himself inside the unit and has made threats. It is not believed anyone else is at risk.
The declaration was made at 1pm under the Public Safety Preservation Act and covers a radius of around 60 metres which includes a section of Lee Street near Charles Street. The area also includes the intersections of Charles and Lee streets and Charles and Lower King streets. Traffic diversions are in place.

item.title: Women share misery of sexual harassment at work on secret-sharing app Whisper
item.description: Women have taken to Whisper to confess anonymously to the day-to-day suffering they experience at the hands of their bosses and the colleagues who blame them for it.

item.title: Yazidi boy relives experience at ISIS jihad camp for lesson in BEHEADING
item.description: Taha said the terror group tried to indoctrinate his class into becoming Islamic extremists, helping form an army they boasted would march on Rome, before defeating America and the west.

item.title: Did Carly McBride's killer close her Facebook account?
item.description: Detectives hunting for missing - believed murdered - NSW mother Carly McBride have called on Facebook in the US to trace who shut down her Facebook page 24 hours after she vanished.

item.title: Paedophile Maurice Van Ryn dubbed the 'Big Cheese' wants sentence reduced
item.description: A man who is facing courts over the repeated sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy has complained of overcrowding in NSW jails during his sentencing.

item.title: Woman sues Emirates Airlines after she slipped on a blanket
item.description: Marie Hobbs is suing Emirates Airlines over claims she was left permanently disabled after she slipped on an airline blanket while trying to help another passenger on a flight from Perth to Dubai.

item.title: Beauty junkie goes without makeup for a week... and vows NEVER again
item.description: Makeup addict Pippa Park, 26, from London, says she would never usually leave the house without a full face. But FEMAIL challenged her to ditch the war paint for one week. Here's how she got on...

item.title: Skaters hit a half pipe in the middle of Australian cannabis crop
item.description: A group of skaters have built a half pipe surrounded by cannabis. Afends, an alternative fashion brand out of Byron Bay, headed to the largest hemp field in Australia to produce the clip.

item.title: Childcare worker Shannon Grant McCoole who sexually abused children jailed
item.description: A former Families SA childcare worker who admitted to multiple child sex and child pornography offences has been jailed for up to 35 years.

item.title: Historic Canberra Hyatt hotel makes embarrassing typo on its menu
item.description: Canberra's five star hotel the Hyatt has accidentally claimed to serve 'Grilled Moroccan Aborigine' in an extremely unfortunate error. The hotel only made the situation worse with their ignorant response.

item.title: Wellington man and his 2 kids escape sinking car after it crashed into the sea
item.description: Neighbours woke up to the sound of a crash and children's screams in Wellington, New Zealand, after a car smashed through a fence and rolled into the ocean on Friday morning.

item.title: Camera fitted to hammerhead shark shows how it stalks its prey
item.description: The GoPro camera stayed on the shark's fin for almost three hours and took in a tour of the sea bed to give photographer Mr Casagrande a unique viewpoint of the creature's adventures.

item.title: Are these the world's weirdest wedding photos?
item.description: Couples are showing their creative side in unusual wedding photos from around the world, including a barely-dressed bride, half-horse newlyweds and face-painted couple.

item.title: Feminism photos by photographer Liora K captures topless women fighting sexism
item.description: Photographer Liora K moved to Tucson, Arizona, in 2010 and has since struggled with the state's treatment of women's rights, so she created the new photo series to help women fight for their rights.

item.title: China is selling tickets to new Earth-like planet Kepler-452b for just TWO PENCE
item.description: The listing offering tickets to the potentially habitable Kepler-452b appeared on Taobao, the Chinese equivalent to eBay. But unfortunately the newly discovered exo-planet is 1,400 light years away.
